Class PondLife

  • java.lang.Object
    • PondLife

  • public class PondLife
extends java.lang.Object
    The PondLife Java application runs a simple simulation that models the fish and weeds in a pond.

    The simulation is currently set up to use these values:

    • Number of weeds in the pond: 2000
    • Initial size of each weed: 15 ounces
    • Growth rate of weeds: 2.5 ounces/week
    • Initial number of fish in the pond: 300
    • Fish size: 50 ounces
    • A fish must eat 0.5 times its size during one week, or it will die.
    • Average number of weeds nibbled by a fish over a week: 30
    • At the end of each week, some fish have babies. The total number of new fish born is the current number of fish times the 0.05 (rounded down to an integer).
    • Number of weeks to simulate: 38

    Java Source Code for this class: http://www.cs.colorado.edu/~main/applications/PondLife.java

    See Also:
    Organism, Plant, Herbivore

      • totalMass

        public static <T extends Organism> double totalMass(java.util.Vector<T> organisms)
        Calculate the total mass of a collection of Organisms.
        Type Parameters:
        T - component type of the elements in the organisms Vector Precondition: Every object in organisms is an Organism.
        Parameters:
        organisms - a Vector of Organism objects
        Returns:
        the total mass of all the objects in Organism (in ounces).
